class family_graph.FamilyGraph[source]¶

Bases: object

Representation of a family graph using an adjacency map.

Class represents different relations between vertices.

endpoints()[source]¶

Return (u,v) tuple for vertices u and v.

opposite(v)[source]¶

Return the vertex that is opposite v on this edge.

type()[source]¶

Return element associated with this edge.

class Vertex(person)[source]¶

Bases: object

Lightweight vertex structure for a graph.

Return element associated with this vertex.

adjacent_vertices(v, type=None)[source]¶

Returns all adjacent vertices if type if None, otherwise returns vertices, which connected with special type of edge.

degree(v)[source]¶

Return number of outgoing edges incident to vertex v in the graph.

draw(vertex)[source]¶

Draws graph from given vertex down. :param vertex: Vertex :return: dict

edge_count()[source]¶

Return the number of edges in the graph.

edges()[source]¶

Return a set of all edges of the graph.

get_edge(u, v)[source]¶

Return the edge from u to v, or None if not adjacent.

graph_intersection(other)[source]¶

Returns True if at least 1 vertex from self is in other. :param other: FamilyGraph :return: bool

incident_edges(v)[source]¶

Return all outgoing edges incident to vertex v in the graph.

insert_edge(u, v, type)[source]¶

Insert and return a new Edge from u to v with auxiliary element x. Raise a ValueError if u and v are not vertices of the graph. Raise a ValueError if u and v are already adjacent.

insert_vertex(x=None)[source]¶

Insert and return a new Vertex with element x.

vertex_count()[source]¶

Return the number of vertices in the graph.

vertices()[source]¶

Return an iteration of all vertices of the graph.
